instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

error - “An error occurred loading the update “

Tried with new ssd

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
threads.message: Try to install an older macOS version; directly from USB.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
threads.message:
Unfortunately the restore option is failing when I try from an external SSD. 
Please find the error details attached in the link.
Also tried to install macos X (using Ctrl+R) I got the same error again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
threads.message: Try with LAN connection, instead of WiFi...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
threads.message: Tried LAN, but That doesn't help. For the time being, I have used a pre-loaded internal SSD But a bit afraid that customer will face the same problem when they get the upgrade option.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
threads.message:
I have tried to upgrade the os from preloaded bigsur to Montero while upgrading it's stopped 
" Installation can not proceed because the installer is damaged"
What does it mean ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
threads.message:
Does the client really need Monterey?
It is known for getting strange issues; not recommended for old machines.

Try inserting an SSD upgraded to Monterey on other machine.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
threads.message: Please note that the issue is not just for Monterey, It's failing to load any OS including old OS's

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Problem while loading OS update
threads.message:
"I have used a pre-loaded internal SSD
----------------------------------------------
I have tried to upgrade the os from preloaded bigsur to Montero"
I was thinking you've already booted an old macOS.
If yes, explain to the client and tell him to keep actual version.
